title: The Surprising Age When Shoveling Snow Turns Risky for Your Heart
desc: Hidden heart disease and other risk factors cause a spike in heart attacks when it snows, especially for people of a certain age.

title: Thalassemia treatment costs RM3mil per patient, Parliament heard
desc: KUALA LUMPUR: It costs around RM3mil to treat a thalassemia patient from infancy up to the age of 40, says Datuk Seri Dr Dzulkefly Ahmad.

title: UPL share price tanks 14% following the company's reorganisation plan; finer details and what analysts said
desc: UPL share price in focus: The scheme will create two listed entities: i) UPL, an existing listed company, as a diversified agriculture and speciality chemicals platform, and ii) UPL Global as a dedicated crop protection platform.

title: Smartphone makers Vivo, Oppo among new contenders targeting DJI’s Pocket 3
desc: Margin pressure in the smartphone market is one factor behind the move, but not the only one.

title: Ex-soldier, pastor jailed for death of man over alleged fake GH¢50 claims
desc: A retired Military Officer, Joseph Abusah, and a Pastor, Benjamin Kofi Agbetiafah, have been convicted by the High Court in Accra for manslaughter over a misunderstanding of GH¢50 alleged fake money leading to the death of one Solomon Dapaah.

title: How the Ola empire is fueling Bhavish’s personal AI business, Krutrim
desc: Bhavish Aggarwal's AI venture, Krutrim, heavily relies on revenue from Ola companies, raising governance concerns. With 90% of its ₹101.7 crore revenue sourced from and costs shared with related entities, experts urge transparency and flag director responsibilities to minority shareholders.

title: Experimental Cholesterol Lowering Treatment Offers Hope for Millions
desc: Study could lead to new options for people at risk for heart attacks and strokes.

title: BAFTAs 2026 full winners list: One Battle After Another triumphs, Robert Aramayo upsets heavy hitters
desc: Timothee Chalamet, Leonardo DiCaprio and Ethan Hawke all lost out to a British actor who looked as shocked as anyone else when his name was read out as the winner.
